title: Gin and tonic sorbet with cucumber

ingredients.content: 200 g tonic water, frozen into ice cubes
325 g cucumber, peeled and cut into pieces (2 cm)
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith

preparations.content: Place sugar and tonic water into mixing bowl and cook <b>5 min/100°C/speed 3<b>. Transfer into a jug and set aside to cool (approx. 30 minutes).

Place frozen tonic water, cucumber, lemon juice, gin and reserved cooled syrup into mixing bowl and mix <b>3 min/speed 4<b>. Pour mixture, up to 4 cm high, into shallow freezable containers and cover with plastic wrap. Place into freezer until set (approx. 8 hours). Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Cut frozen gin mixture into pieces (approx. 4 cm). Place frozen gin pieces into mixing bowl and crush <b>30 sec/speed 9<b>, then mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b> with aid of spatula. Transfer into a freezable container and place into freezer for a minimum of 3 hours, or until set. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 170°C. Line 2 baking trays (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and chop <b>6 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/70°C/speed 2<b>.
Add all remaining ingredients, including reserved almonds, and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.

Divide mixture between prepared trays. Using spatula or the back of a metal spoon, spread out into a thin layer (approx. 1 mm). Bake for 10 minutes (170°C). Carefully cut or break into shards, then return tuiles to oven and bake for a further 1-2 minutes (170°), or until golden brown. Set aside to cool completely.

hintsAndTricks: For a refreshing slushie, place sorbet into glasses after mixing in step 3 and serve with a straw or long-handled spoon.
We recommend using good quality gin.
